name: Copyright Safeguard Footer Notice
author: Robert Nicholson

sections.description: Places a Copyright Safeguard notice in the site’s footer, or in the page content (using a shortcode). The notice can be a button or a simple text link. Clicking the notice causes a small pop-up window to appear with information about the site’s copyright protection. Using this plugin requires the user to sign up for a free account on the Copyright Safeguard website, where the site’s copyright information is stored.
sections.installation:
1. Upload CopyrightSafeguard-fn.zip to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Go to the Copyright Safeguard website (http://www.copyrightsafeguard.com) and register for a free account, where you can enter the informaiton about your website.
  4. In your WordPress Dashboard, go to the Settings menu and open the Copyright Safeguard configuration screen.
  5. Enter the Copyright Safeguard Authorization Code, and select the link style to appear in your site footer.
sections.faq:
Why do I need to register for an account on the Copyright Safeguard website?

That’s where the information about your site is stored.

Is registering with Copyright Safeguard the same as registered my copyright?

No. Copyright Safeguard is a free service. There is a small fee to register your copyright with the US Copyright Office, which provides certain additional legal protections. There is a great deal of information about copyright protection on the Copyright Safeguard website.
